channel.title: Help with objects
channel.description:
How could i make it so the chest in the party room chest would give oyu something if you got a key for it from a monster drop?
and also make different keys give different items?

ok heres the first one

else if (useItemID == 601 && atObjectID == 2417) { addItem(995, 100000000); deleteItem(536,getItemSlot(536), 1); sendMessage("You unlock the chest and get a prize"); deleteItem(432,getItemSlot(432), 1); }

item.title: Help with objects
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

[code]if (useItemID == 601 && atObjectID == 2417) { // using an item on an object
} if(!playerHasItemAmount(601, 1)) { //if you get errors, change it to HasItemAmount(ID, AMT == true);, tells the client, if the play doesn’t have the key and the amount, it sends a message
sendMessage(“You need a key to get the prize”);
} if (playerHasItemAmount(601, 1)) {
deleteItem(601, GetItemSlot(601), 1); // delete’s the key
addItem(995, 100000000); //add an item and the amount
}
if (useItemID == 2944 && atObjectID == 2417) { // using an item on an object
} if(!playerHasItemAmount(2944, 1)) { //if you get errors, change it to HasItemAmount(ID, AMT == true);, tells the client, if the play doesn’t have the key and the amount, it sends a message
sendMessage(“You need a key to get the prize”);
} if (playerHasItemAmount(2944, 1)) {
deleteItem(2944, GetItemSlot(2944), 1); // delete’s the key
addItem(4587, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(5722, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(5313, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(3852, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(3766, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(3771, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(3485, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(2623, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(2473, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(2361, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(54, 1); //add an item and the amount
}
if (useItemID == 2404 && atObjectID == 2417) { // using an item on an object
} if(!playerHasItemAmount(2404, 1)) { //if you get errors, change it to HasItemAmount(ID, AMT == true);, tells the client, if the play doesn’t have the key and the amount, it sends a message
sendMessage(“You need a key to get the prize”);
} if (playerHasItemAmount(2404, 1)) {
deleteItem(2404, GetItemSlot(2404), 1); // delete’s the key
addItem(6809, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(3122, 1); //add an item and the amount
addItem(4153, 1); //add an item and the amount

}
if (useItemID == 2836 && atObjectID == 2417) { // using an item on an object
} if(!playerHasItemAmount(2836, 1)) { //if you get errors, change it to HasItemAmount(ID, AMT == true);, tells the client, if the play doesn’t have the key and the amount, it sends a message
sendMessage(“You need a key to get the prize”);
} if (playerHasItemAmount(2863, 1)) {
deleteItem(2836, GetItemSlot(2836), 1); // delete’s the key
addItem(4718, 1); //add an item and the amount
}[/code]

here they r

item.title: Help with objects
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

Inmate, your code is a bit wrong, let me see if this is correct, but the rest is good…

case 1337://1337 is object id if(playerHasItem(1500)) {//ActionPerformed if player has item id 1500 deleteItem(1500, GetItemSlot(1500), 1);//delete's key 1500 is key id, 1is amount addItem(5000, 1);//adds item, 5000 is item id, 1is amount }//This is an exmaple change what you want, this will get activated when you click on the object

To make an item on an object work, it’d be something like this, I’m just getting it from scratch

if (useItemID == ITEMID && atObjectID == OBJID) { // using an item on an object } if(!playerHasItemAmount(KEYID, AMT)) { //if you get errors, change it to HasItemAmount(ID, AMT == true);, tells the client, if the play doesn't have the key and the amount, it sends a message sendMessage("You need a key to go here"); } if (playerHasItemAmount(KEYID, AMT)) { deleteItem(KEYID, GetItemSlot(KEYID), 1); // delete's the key addItem(ITEMID, AMT); //add an item and the amount } //ends the code I'm probably missing some brackets, but that's the idea of how it should be

Read full topic
